sen.j: 小倉駅（おぐらえき）は、京都府宇治市小倉町神楽田にある、近畿日本鉄道近鉄京都線の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Ogura Station is located in Kaguraden, Ogura-cho, Uji City Kyoto Prefecture and, is on the Kintetsu Railways Kyoto line.
Ogura Station, a facility on Kintetsu Railways' Kyoto Line, is located in Kaguraden, Ogura-cho, Uji City Kyoto Prefecture.
Ogura Station, located in Kaguraden, Ogura-cho, Uji City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on the Kintetsu Kyoto Line, which is operated by Kintetsu Corporation.
sen.cmt: 他の記事と表現を統一しました。Kintetsu Kyoto Line→the Kintetsu Kyoto Lineに変更しました。

sen.j: 近くに西日本旅客鉄道奈良線のJR小倉駅がある。
sen.e: Nearby is JR Ogura Station on the Nara Line of the West Japan Passenger Railways.
Nearby is JR Ogura Station, which is on the Nara Line of West Japan Passenger Railways.
Nearby is JR Ogura Station, which is on the Nara Line of West Japan Railway Company (JR West).
sen.cmt: West Japan Railway Company (JR West) に変更しました。

sen.j: 駅構造
sen.e: Station Construction
The station's structure
Station layout
sen.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 相対式2面2線のホームを持つ地上駅。
sen.e: The station is above ground with 2 single-sided platforms facing each other with 2 sets of tracks running between.
The station is above ground with two separate platforms that face each other with two sets of tracks running between.
The station is above ground with two separate platforms that face each other with two sets of tracks running between.

sen.j: ホーム有効長は6両。
sen.e: The platforms are effectively 6 carriage lengths long.
The platforms are effectively six carriage lengths long.
The platforms are effectively six carriage lengths long.

sen.j: 互いのホームを結ぶ跨線橋も地下道も無いため、両ホームとも改札口が別々に存在する。
sen.e: As there is no overpass or underpass linking the two platforms, there are separate ticket barriers for each platform.
Because there is no overpass or underpass linking the two platforms, there are separate ticket barriers for each.
Because there is no overpass or underpass linking the two platforms, there are separate ticket gates for each.

sen.j: 便所は両ホームの改札内にあり、いずれも男女別の汲み取り式便所となっている。
sen.e: There are rest-rooms located inside the platform's ticket-barrier: men's and women's toilets are separate and septic-tank arrangements.
There are restrooms located inside the platform's ticket barrier: men's and women's toilets are separate, each with their own septic-tank arrangements.
There are restrooms located inside the platform's ticket gate: men's and women's toilets are separate, each being a vault toilet.
sen.cmt: barriers →gates としました。vault toilet としました。

sen.j: かつては優等列車用の通過線を抱えた構造となっており、現在のホームの一部は以前の待避線の上に作られている。
sen.e: Formerly the station was equipped with a side-track to enable priority trains to pass through. A portion of the current platforms has been built above the old side-track.
Formerly the station was equipped with a sidetrack that allowed priority trains to pass through; however, a portion of the current platform arrangement has been built above the old sidetrack.
Formerly the station was equipped with a sidetrack that allowed priority trains to pass through; however, a portion of the current platform arrangement has been built above the old sidetrack.

sen.j: この待避線は、1980年代半ばに隣接する向島駅の待避線が使用を開始したのに合わせて廃止された。
sen.e: In mid-1980's the adjacent Mukaijima Station commenced using this side-track however, both have ceased this practice.
In the mid-1980s, the adjacent Mukaijima Station commenced using this sidetrack, but both have ceased the practice.
This sidetrack have ceased the practice when the adjacent Mukaijima Station commenced using the sidetrack in the mid-1980s.
sen.cmt: 原文の意味に合わせて修正しました。

sen.j: なお自動改札機は東芝製が設置されている。
sen.e: Automatic ticket turnstile equipment made by Toshiba has been installed.
The automatic ticket turnstile equipment was manufactured by Toshiba.
The automatic ticket gate was manufactured by Toshiba.
sen.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 赤い自動改札機（EG-2000）は出場時2枚一括処理、PiTaPa・ICOCAに対応する。
sen.e: With the appearance of the red automatic ticket turnstile equipment (EG-2000) 2 tickets could be processed simultaneously and PiTaPa/ICOCA multi-trip tickets handled.
With the appearance of the red automatic ticket turnstile equipment (EG-2000), two tickets can be processed simultaneously and PiTaPa/ICOCA multi-trip tickets are handled.

The red-colored ticket gates (EG-2000) can handle two IC cards at a time when a passenger is exiting, and PiTaPa Card and ICOCA, both of which are IC cards, are available for payment of railway fares at this ticket gate.
sen.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 利用状況
sen.e: Usage
Usage
Passenger use
sen.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 2005年11月8日の調査結果によると、1日の利用客は18,542人。
sen.e: According to a survey taken on November 8, 2005: 18,542 passengers used the facilities daily.
According to a survey taken on November 8, 2005, 18,542 passengers used the facility.
According to a survey taken on November 8, 2005, 18,542 passengers used the facility.

sen.j: 近鉄の全調査対象駅（323駅、但し調査当時の数）中、38位。
sen.e: Ranked 38th amongst all stations surveyed by Kintetsu (323 stations at the time the survey was taken).
It's ranked thirty-eighth among all stations surveyed by Kintetsu (323 stations were included in the survey).
It's ranked thirty-eighth among all stations surveyed by Kintetsu (323 stations at that time).
sen.cmt: 調査当時 を追加しました。

sen.j: 京都線の駅（26駅、大和西大寺駅含む）の中では、7位。
sen.e: Ranked 7th amongst stations along the Kyoto Line (26 stations, including Yamato-Saidaiji Station).
It's ranked seventh among stations along the Kyoto Line (26, including Yamato-Saidaiji Station).
It's ranked seventh among stations along the Kyoto Line (26, including Yamato-Saidaiji Station).

sen.j: 同線の急行通過駅では最多。
sen.e: This line has the most stations that express trains pass-by without stopping.
This line has the most stations that express trains pass without stopping.
This station has the highest number of passengers among stations that express trains pass without stopping on the Kyoto Line.
sen.cmt: 翻訳を一部修正しました。

sen.j: 京都府内の近鉄の駅（23駅）の中では、5位。
sen.e: Ranked 5th amongst railway stations in Kyoto Prefecture(23 stations).
It's ranked fifth among railway stations in Kyoto Prefecture (23 stations).
It's ranked fifth among railway stations in Kyoto Prefecture (23 stations).

sen.j: 駅周辺
sen.e: Station Vicinity
The station's surroundings
Station surroundings
sen.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.e: Bus
Bus
Bus

sen.j: どちらも京阪宇治バス。
sen.e: Invariably a Keihan Uji Bus
Invariably a Keihan Uji bus
Invariably a Keihan Uji bus

sen.j: 小倉駅前
sen.e: In front of Ogura Station
In front of Ogura Station
In front of Ogura Station

sen.j: 駅西北の京都銀行小倉支店前交差点西にある。
sen.e: West pedestrian crossing: north-west of the station out front of the Ogura Branch of the Bank of Kyoto.
West pedestrian crossing: Northwest of the station out front of the Ogura branch of the Bank of Kyoto
It is located on the west side of pedestrian crossing which is located in front of the Ogura branch of the Bank of Kyoto which is northwest of the station.
sen.cmt: 原文の通りに修正しました。

sen.j: 310号系統：大久保駅 (京都府)行/（宇治駅 (JR西日本)経由）宇治市役所・宇治市文化センター行
sen.e: Prefectural Highway Route# 310: Heading towards Okubo Station (Kyoto Prefecture)/(Heading towards Uji City Hall/ Uji City Cultural Centre) via Uji Station (JR West Japan)
Prefectural Highway Route 310: Heading toward Okubo Station (Kyoto Prefecture)/(heading toward Uji City Hall/ Uji City Cultural Center) via Uji Station (JR West Japan)
Route 310: For Okubo Station (Kyoto Prefecture)/Uji City Hall and Uji City Cultural Center (via Uji Station (JR West))
sen.cmt: 表現を一部修正しました。

sen.j: 近鉄小倉
sen.e: Kintetsu Ogura
Kintetsu Ogura
Kintetsu Ogura

sen.j: 駅東の府道上にある。
sen.e: Is east of the station on the Prefectural Highway.
It's east of the station on the Prefectural Highway.
It's east of the station on the Prefectural Route.

sen.j: 35号・35B号系統：近鉄大久保行/宇治車庫（35号）・京都府立莵道高等学校前（35B号）
sen.e: Routes 35 & ３５B: Heading towards Kintetsu Okubo/Uji garage (Route 35)/ In front of Kyoto Prefectural Todo Senior High School (Route 35B).
Routes 35 & ３５B: Heading toward Kintetsu Okubo/Uji garage (Route 35) and the front of Kyoto Prefectural Todo Senior High School (Route 35B), respectively
Routes 35 & 35B: For Kintetsu Okubo/Uji Shako-depot (Route 35) and the front of Kyoto Prefectural Todo Senior High School (Route 35B), respectively

sen.j: 歴史
sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 1928年（昭和3年）11月3日 奈良電気鉄道桃山御陵前駅～西大寺（現・大和西大寺駅）間開通時に開業。
sen.e: November 3, 1928: Route from Nara Electric Railway Momoyama Goryomae Station to Saidaiji (present day Yamato-Saidaiji Station) opened.
November 3, 1928: The route from Nara Electric Railway Momoyama Goryomae Station to Saidaiji (present day Yamato-Saidaiji Station) opened.
November 3, 1928: The route from Nara Electric Railway Momoyamagoryomae Station to Saidaiji (present day Yamato-Saidaiji Station) opened.

sen.j: 1962年（昭和37年）12月 上下待避線設置（のち廃止）。
sen.e: December 1962: Side–track leading off both sets of tracks set up (late abandoned).
December 1962: A sidetrack leading off both sets of tracks was established (but later abandoned).
December 1962: A sidetrack leading off both sets of tracks was established (but later abandoned).

sen.j: 1963年（昭和38年）10月1日 会社合併により近畿日本鉄道の駅となる。
sen.e: October 1, 1963: Due to a company merger, becomes a Kinki Japan Railway station.
October 1, 1963: The facility became a Kinki Japan Railway station due to the company merger.
October 1, 1963: The facility became a Kintetsu station due to the company merger.

sen.j: 2007年（平成19年）4月1日 PiTaPa使用開始。
sen.e: April 1, 2007: Commences using PiTaPa multi-trip tickets.
April 1, 2007: PiTaPa multi-trip tickets were accepted.
April 1, 2007: PiTaPa Card became usable.
sen.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: なお奈良電気鉄道では、ここから分岐して大阪環状線玉造駅付近に至る、第4の京阪都市間路線を計画していた。
sen.e: Nara Electric Railroad made plans to diverge from here heading in the direction of the vicinity of Tamatsukuri Station on the Osaka Kanjo Line, 4th line of the Keihan (Kyoto-Osaka) city link line.
Nara Electric Railroad made plans to diverge from here, heading toward the vicinity of Tamatsukuri Station on the Osaka Kanjo Line, the fourth line of the Keihan (Kyoto-Osaka) city link line.
Nara Electric Railroad made plans to diverge from here, heading toward the vicinity of Tamatsukuri Station on the Osaka Loop Line, the fourth line of the Keihan (Kyoto-Osaka) city link line.
sen.cmt: Osaka Loop Line としました。
